description: An LDPC that is similar to a LDP-DC but it allows an indirection with the ability to list as member a resource, such as a URI representing a real-world object, that is different from the resource that is created
The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc.
A name given to the resource.

This relation points to the identifier of the FAIR Data Point that is related to this container. The object of this property MUST be an instance of fdp-o:FAIRDataPoint. Here, typically an row (i.e. instance) of the Endpoint table.
